events.name: SW_INCR
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, Condition code check pass, software increment This event counts any instruction architecturally executed (condition code check pass)

events.name: L1I_CACHE_REFILL
events.description: Level 1 instruction cache refill This event counts any instruction fetch which misses in the cache. The following instructions are not counted: - Cache maintenance instructions - Non-cacheable accesses

events.name: L1I_TLB_REFILL
events.description: Level 1 instruction TLB refill This event counts any refill of the L1 instruction TLB from the MMU Translation Cache (MMUTC). This includes refills that result in a translation fault. The following instructions are not counted: - TLB maintenance instructions This event counts regardless of whether the MMU is enabled

events.name: L1D_CACHE_REFILL
events.description: Level 1 data cache refill This event counts any load or store operation or translation table walk that causes data to be read from outside the L1 cache, including accesses which do not allocate into L1. The following instructions are not counted: - Cache maintenance instructions and prefetches. - Stores of an entire cache line, even if they make a coherency request outside the L1. - Partial cache line writes which do not allocate into the L1 cache. - Non-cacheable accesses. This event counts the sum of L1D_CACHE_REFILL_RD and L1D_CACHE_REFILL_WR

events.name: L1D_CACHE
events.description: Level 1 data cache access This event counts any load or store operation or translation table walk that looks up in the L1 data cache. In particular, any access that could count the L1D_CACHE_REFILL event causes this event to count. The following instructions are not counted: - Cache maintenance instructions and prefetches. - Non-cacheable accesses. This event counts the sum of L1D_CACHE_RD and L1D_CACHE_WR

events.name: L1D_TLB_REFILL
events.description: Level 1 data TLB refill This event counts any refill of the data L1 TLB from the L2 TLB. This includes refills which result in a translation fault. The following instructions are not counted: - TLB maintenance instructions. This event counts regardless of whether the MMU is enabled

events.name: INST_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed This event counts all retired instructions, including ones that fail their condition check

events.name: EXC_TAKEN
events.description: Exception taken The counter counts each exception taken

events.name: EXC_RETURN
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, Condition code check pass, exception return

events.name: CID_WRITE_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, Condition code check pass, write to CONTEXTIDR This event only counts writes using the CONTEXTIDR_EL1 mnemonic. Writes to CONTEXTIDR_EL12 and CONTEXTIDR_EL2 are not counted

events.name: PC_WRITE_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, Condition code check pass, software change of the PC This event counts all branches taken and popped from the branch monitor. This excludes exception entries, debug entries, and CCFAIL branches

events.name: BR_IMMED_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, immediate branch This event counts all branches decoded as immediate branches, taken or not, and popped from the branch monitor. This excludes exception entries, debug entries, and CCFAIL branches

events.name: BR_RETURN_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, Condition code check pass, procedure return

events.name: BR_MIS_PRED
events.description: Mispredicted or not predicted branch speculatively executed This event counts any predictable branch instruction which is mispredicted either due to dynamic misprediction or because the MMU is off and the branches are statically predicted not taken

events.name: CPU_CYCLES
events.description: Cycle

events.name: BR_PRED
events.description: Predictable branch speculatively executed This event counts all predictable branches

events.name: MEM_ACCESS
events.description: Data memory access This event counts memory accesses due to load or store instructions. The following instructions are not counted: - Instruction fetches. - Cache maintenance instructions. - Translation table walks or prefetches. This event counts the sum of MEM_ACCESS_RD and MEM_ACCESS_WR

events.name: L1I_CACHE
events.description: Level 1 instruction cache access This event counts any instruction fetch which accesses the L1 instruction cache. The following instructions are not counted: - Cache maintenance instructions. - Non-cacheable accesses

events.name: L1D_CACHE_WB
events.description: Level 1 data cache write-back This event counts any write-back of data from the L1 data cache to L2 or L3. The event counts both victim line evictions and snoops, including cache maintenance operations. The following instructions are not counted: - Invalidations which do not result in data being transferred out of the L1. - Full-line writes which write to L2 without writing L1, such as write-streaming mode

events.name: L2D_CACHE
events.description: Level 2 data cache access - If the core is configured with a per-core L2 cache, this event counts any transaction from L1 which looks up in the L2 cache, and any writeback from the L1 to the L2. Snoops from outside the core and cache maintenance operations are not counted. - If the core is not configured with a per-core L2 cache, this event counts the cluster cache event, as defined by L3D_CACHE. - If neither a per-core cache nor a cluster cache are configured, then this event is not implemented

events.name: L2D_CACHE_REFILL
events.description: Level 2 data cache refill - If the core is configured with a per-core L2 cache, this event counts any Cacheable transaction from L1 which causes data to be read from outside the core. L2 refills caused by stashes into L2 are not meant to be counted. - If the core is not configured with a per-core L2 cache, this event counts the cluster cache event, as defined by L3D_CACHE_REFILL. - If neither a per-core cache nor a cluster cache are configured, then this event is not implemented

events.name: L2D_CACHE_WB
events.description: Level 2 data cache write-back If the core is configured with a per-core L2 cache, this event counts any write-back of data from the L2 cache to a location outside the core. The event includes snoops to the L2 which return data, regardless of whether they cause an invalidation. Invalidations from the L2 which do not write data outside of the core and snoops which return data from the L1 are not counted. - If the core is not configured with a per-core L2 cache, this event is not implemented

events.name: BUS_ACCESS
events.description: This event counts for every beat of data that is transferred over the data channels between the core and the SCU. If both read and write data beats are transferred on a given cycle, this event is counted twice on that cycle. This event counts the sum of BUS_ACCESS_RD and BUS_ACCESS_WR

events.name: INST_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed This event duplicates INST_RETIRED

events.name: TTBR_WRITE_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, condition code check pass, write to TTBR This event only counts writes to TTBR0/TTBR1 in AArch32 and TTBR0_EL1/TTBR1_EL1 in AArch64. The following instructions are not counted: - Accesses to TTBR0_EL12/TTBR1_EL12 or TTBR0_EL2/TTBR1_EL2

events.name: BUS_CYCLES
events.description: Bus cycle This event duplicates CPU_CYCLES

events.name: CHAIN
events.description: For odd-numbered counters, this event increments the count by one for each overflow of the preceding even-numbered counter. For even numbered counters, there is no increment

events.name: L2D_CACHE_ALLOCATE
events.description: Level 2 data cache allocation without refill This event counts any full cache line write into the L2 cache which does not cause a linefill, including write-backs from L1 to L2 and full-line writes which do not allocate into L1

events.name: BR_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, branch This event counts all branches, taken or not, popped from the branch monitor. This excludes exception entries, debug entries, and CCFAIL branches. In the ** core, an ISB is a branch, and even micro architectural ISBs are counted

events.name: BR_MIS_PRED_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, mispredicted branch This event counts any branch that is counted by BR_RETIRED which is not correctly predicted and causes a pipeline clean

events.name: STALL_FRONTEND
events.description: No operation has been issued, because of the frontend The counter counts on any cycle when no operations are issued due to the instruction queue being empty

events.name: STALL_BACKEND
events.description: No operation has been issued, because of the backend The counter counts on any cycle when no operations are issued due to a pipeline stall

events.name: L1D_TLB
events.description: Level 1 data TLB access This event counts any load or store operation which accesses the data L1 TLB. If both a load and a store are executed on a cycle, this event counts twice. This event counts regardless of whether the MMU is enabled

events.name: L1I_TLB
events.description: Level 1 instruction TLB access This event counts any instruction fetch which accesses the instruction L1 TLB. This event counts regardless of whether the MMU is enabled

events.name: L3D_CACHE_ALLOCATE
events.description: Attributable level 3 data or unified cache allocation without refill This event counts any full cache line write into the L3 cache which does not cause a linefill, including write-backs from L2 to L3 and full-line writes which do not allocate into L2. This event also counts WriteUnique and datafull WriteEvictOrEvict

events.name: L3D_CACHE_REFILL
events.description: Attributable level 3 data or unified cache refill This event counts for any cacheable read transaction returning data from the SCU for which the data source was outside the cluster

events.name: L3D_CACHE
events.description: Attributable level 3 data or unified cache access This event counts for any cacheable read, write or write-back transaction sent to the SCU

events.name: L2D_TLB_REFILL
events.description: Level 2 data TLB refill This event counts on any refill of the L2 TLB, caused by either an instruction or data access. This event does not count if the MMU is disabled

events.name: L2D_TLB
events.description: Level 2 data TLB access Attributable level 2 unified TLB access. This event counts on any access to the L2 TLB (caused by a refill of any of the L1 TLBs). This event does not count if the MMU is disabled

events.name: REMOTE_ACCESS
events.description: Access to another socket in a multi-socket system This event counts any transactions returning data from another socket in a multi-socket system

events.name: DTLB_WALK
events.description: Data TLB access with at least one translation table walk Access to data TLB that caused a translation table walk. This event counts on any data access which causes L2D_TLB_REFILL to count

events.name: ITLB_WALK
events.description: Instruction TLB access with at least one translation table walk Access to instruction TLB that caused a translation table walk. This event counts on any instruction access which causes L2D_TLB_REFILL to count

events.name: LL_CACHE_RD
events.description: Last level cache access, read This event counts any cacheable read transaction which returns a data source of 'interconnect cache', 'DRAM', 'remote' or 'inter-cluster peer'

events.name: LL_CACHE_MISS_RD
events.description: Last Level cache miss read This event counts any cacheable read transaction which returns a data source of 'DRAM', 'remote' or 'inter-cluster peer'

events.name: L1D_CACHE_LMISS_RD
events.description: Level 1 data cache long-latency read miss Level 1 data cache access, read. This event counts any load operation or translation table walk access which looks up in the L1 data cache. In particular, any access which could count the L1D_CACHE_REFILL_RD event causes this event to count. The following instructions are not counted: - Cache maintenance instructions and prefetches. - Non-cacheable accesses

events.name: OP_RETIRED
events.description: Micro-operation architecturally executed This event counts each operation counted by OP_SPEC that would be executed in a simple sequential execution of the program

events.name: OP_SPEC
events.description: Micro-operation speculatively executed This event counts the number of operations executed by the core, including those that are executed speculatively and would not be executed in a simple sequential execution of the program

events.name: STALL
events.description: No operation sent for execution This event counts every Attributable cycle on which no Attributable instruction or operation was sent for execution on this core

events.name: STALL_SLOT_BACKEND
events.description: No operation sent for execution on a slot due to the backend Counts each slot counted by STALL_SLOT where no Attributable instruction or operation was sent for execution because the backend is unable to accept one of: - The instruction operation available for the PE on the slot. - Any operations on the slot

events.name: STALL_SLOT_FRONTEND
events.description: No operation sent for execution on a slot due to the frontend Counts each slot counted by STALL_SLOT where no Attributable instruction or operation was sent for execution because there was no Attributable instruction or operation available to issue from the PE from the frontend for the slot

events.name: STALL_SLOT
events.description: No operation sent for execution on a slot The counter counts on each Attributable cycle the number of instruction or operation slots that are not occupied by an instruction or operation Attributable to the PE

events.name: L1D_CACHE_RD
events.description: Level 1 data cache access, read Counts any load operation or translation table walk access which looks up in the L1 data cache. In particular, any access which could count the L1D_CACHE_REFILL_RD event causes this event to count. Cache maintenance instructions and prefetches are not counted. Noncacheable accesses are not counted

events.name: L1D_CACHE_WR
events.description: Level 1 data cache access, write Counts any store operation which looks up in the L1 data cache. In particular, any access which could count the L1D_CACHE_REFILL event causes this event to count. Cache maintenance instructions and prefetches are not counted. Non-cacheable accesses are not counted

events.name: L1D_CACHE_REFILL_INNER
events.description: Level 1 data cache refill, inner This event counts any L1 data cache linefill (as counted by L1D_CACHE_REFILL) which hits in the L2 cache, L3 cache, or another core in the cluster

events.name: L1D_CACHE_REFILL_OUTER
events.description: Level 1 data cache refill, outer This event counts any L1 data cache linefill (as counted by L1D_CACHE_REFILL) which does not hit in the L2 cache, L3 cache, or another core in the cluster, and instead obtains data from outside the cluster

events.name: L1D_CACHE_INVAL
events.description: Level 1 data cache invalidate

events.name: L2D_CACHE_RD
events.description: Level 2 data cache access, read This event counts any transaction issued from L1 caches which looks up in the L2 cache, including requests for instructions fetches and MMU table walks. The transaction is counted regardless of the source that generated it in the L1, being a load, store or prefetch request

events.name: L2D_CACHE_WR
events.description: Level 2 data cache access, write This event counts any full cache line write into the L2 cache which does not cause a linefill, including write-backs from L1 to L2, full-line writes which do not allocate into L1 and MMU descriptor hardware updates performed in L2

events.name: L2D_CACHE_REFILL_RD
events.description: Level 2 data cache refill, read This event counts any cacheable transaction generated by a read operation which causes data to be read from outside the L2. This event is counted on RXDAT, using the type of request to determine if the refill was for a read (line requested in any state)

events.name: L2D_CACHE_REFILL_WR
events.description: Level 2 data cache refill, write This event counts any cacheable transaction generated by a store operation which causes data to be read from outside the L2. Counted on RXDAT, using the type of request to determine if the refill was for a write (line requested in unique state)

events.name: L2D_CACHE_WB_VICTIM
events.description: Level 2 data cache write-back, victim This event counts any datafull write-back operation caused by allocations

events.name: L2D_CACHE_WB_CLEAN
events.description: Level 2 data cache write-back, cleaning, and coherency This event counts any datafull write-back operation caused by cache maintenance operations or external coherency requests

events.name: L2D_CACHE_INVAL
events.description: Level 2 data cache invalidate This event counts any cache maintenance operation which causes the invalidation of a line present in the L2 cache

events.name: BUS_ACCESS_RD
events.description: Bus access, read This event counts for every beat of data that is transferred over the read data channel between the core and the SCU

events.name: BUS_ACCESS_WR
events.description: Bus access, write This event counts for every beat of data that is transferred over the write data channel between the core and the SCU

events.name: MEM_ACCESS_RD
events.description: Data memory access, read This event counts memory accesses due to load instructions. The following instructions are not counted: - The following instructions are not counted: - Instruction fetches - Cache maintenance instructions. - Translation table walks. - Prefetches

events.name: MEM_ACCESS_WR
events.description: Data memory access, write This event counts memory accesses due to store instructions. The following instructions are not counted: - Instruction fetches. - Cache maintenance instructions. - Translation table walks. - Prefetches

events.name: STREX_FAIL_SPEC
events.description: Exclusive operation speculatively executed, Store-Exclusive fail. Exclusive operation speculatively executed, STREX or STX fail

events.name: STREX_SPEC
events.description: Exclusive operation speculatively executed, Store-Exclusive. Exclusive operation speculatively executed, STREX or STX

events.name: LD_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed, load

events.name: ST_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed, store

events.name: DP_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed, integer data processing

events.name: ASE_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed, Advanced SIMD

events.name: VFP_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed, floating-point

events.name: PC_WRITE_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed, software change of the PC

events.name: CRYPTO_SPEC
events.description: Operation speculatively executed, Cryptographic instruction

events.name: ISB_SPEC
events.description: Barrier speculatively executed, ISB

events.name: DSB_SPEC
events.description: Barrier speculatively executed, DSB

events.name: DMB_SPEC
events.description: Barrier speculatively executed, DMB

events.name: EXC_UNDEF
events.description: Exception taken, other synchronous Counts the number of undefined exceptions taken locally

events.name: EXC_SVC
events.description: Exception taken, Supervisor Call Exception taken locally, Supervisor Call

events.name: EXC_PABORT
events.description: Exception taken, Instruction Abort Exception taken locally, Instruction Abort

events.name: EXC_DABORT
events.description: Exception taken, Data Abort or SError Exception taken locally, Data Abort and SError

events.name: EXC_IRQ
events.description: Exception taken, IRQ Exception taken locally, IRQ

events.name: EXC_FIQ
events.description: Exception taken, FIQ Exception taken locally, FIQ

events.name: EXC_SMC
events.description: Exception taken, Secure Monitor Call Exception taken locally, Secure Monitor Call

events.name: EXC_HVC
events.description: Exception taken, Hypervisor Call Exception taken locally, Hypervisor Call

events.name: EXC_TRAP_PABORT
events.description: Exception taken, Instruction Abort not Taken locally

events.name: EXC_TRAP_DABORT
events.description: Exception taken, Data Abort or SError not Taken locally

events.name: EXC_TRAP_OTHER
events.description: Exception taken, other traps not Taken locally

events.name: EXC_TRAP_IRQ
events.description: Exception taken, IRQ not Taken locally

events.name: EXC_TRAP_FIQ
events.description: Exception taken, FIQ not Taken locally

events.name: RC_LD_SPEC
events.description: Release consistency operation speculatively executed, Load-Acquire

events.name: RC_ST_SPEC
events.description: Release consistency operation speculatively executed, Store-Release

events.name: L3D_CACHE_RD
events.description: Level 3 cache read This event counts for any cacheable read transaction sent to the SCU

events.name: SAMPLE_POP
events.description: Statistical Profiling sample population The counter increments for each operation that might be sampled, whether or not the operation was sampled. Operations that are executed at an Exception level or Security state in which the Statistical Profiling Extension is disabled are not counted

events.name: SAMPLE_FEED
events.description: Statistical Profiling sample taken The counter increments each time the sample interval counter reaches zero and is reloaded, and the sample does not collide with the previous sample. Samples that are removed by filtering, or discarded, and not written to the Profiling Buffer are counted

events.name: SAMPLE_FILTRATE
events.description: Statistical Profiling sample taken and not removed by filtering The counter increments each time that a completed sample record is checked against the filters and not removed. Sample records that are not removed by filtering, but are discarded before being written to the Profiling Buffer because of a Profiling Buffer management event, are counted

events.name: SAMPLE_COLLISION
events.description: Statistical Profiling sample collided with previous sample The counter increments for each sample record that is taken when the previous sampled operation has not completed generating its sample record

events.name: CNT_CYCLES
events.description: Constant frequency cycles

events.name: STALL_BACKEND_MEM
events.description: Memory stall cycles The counter is defined identically to STALL_BACKEND_MEM in the AMUv1 architecture

events.name: L1I_CACHE_LMISS
events.description: Level 1 instruction cache long-latency miss The counter counts each access counted by L1I_CACHE that incurs additional latency because it returns instructions from outside the Level 1 instruction cache

events.name: L2D_CACHE_LMISS_RD
events.description: Level 2 data cache long-latency read miss The counter counts each memory read access counted by L2D_CACHE that incurs additional latency because it returns data from outside the Level 2 data or unified cache of this PE

events.name: L3D_CACHE_LMISS_RD
events.description: Level 3 data cache long-latency read miss The counter counts each memory read access counted by L3D_CACHE that incurs additional latency because it returns data from outside the Level 3 data or unified cache of this PE

events.name: TRB_WRAP
events.description: Trace buffer current write pointer wrapped

events.name: PMU_OVFS
events.description: PMU overflow, counters accessible to EL1 and EL0 Note: This event is exported to the trace unit, but cannot be counted in the PMU

events.name: TRB_TRIG
events.description: Trace buffer Trigger Event Note: This event is exported to the trace unit, but cannot be counted in the PMU

events.name: PMU_HOVFS
events.description: PMU overflow, counters reserved for use by EL2 Note: This event is exported to the trace unit, but cannot be counted in the PMU

events.name: TRCEXTOUT0
events.description: PE Trace Unit external output 0 Note: This event is not exported to the trace unit

events.name: TRCEXTOUT1
events.description: PE Trace Unit external output 1 Note: This event is not exported to the trace unit

events.name: TRCEXTOUT2
events.description: PE Trace Unit external output 2 Note: This event is not exported to the trace unit

events.name: TRCEXTOUT3
events.description: PE Trace Unit external output 3 Note: This event is not exported to the trace unit

events.name: CTI_TRIGOUT4
events.description: Cross Trigger Interface output trigger 4

events.name: CTI_TRIGOUT5
events.description: Cross Trigger Interface output trigger 5

events.name: CTI_TRIGOUT6
events.description: Cross Trigger Interface output trigger 6

events.name: CTI_TRIGOUT7
events.description: Cross Trigger Interface output trigger 7

events.name: LDST_ALIGN_LAT
events.description: Access with additional latency from alignment The counter counts each access counted by MEM_ACCESS that, due to the alignment of the address and size of data being accessed, incurred additional latency

events.name: LD_ALIGN_LAT
events.description: Load with additional latency from alignment

events.name: ST_ALIGN_LAT
events.description: Store with additional latency from alignment

events.name: MEM_ACCESS_CHECKED
events.description: Checked data memory access

events.name: MEM_ACCESS_CHECKED_RD
events.description: Checked data memory access, read

events.name: MEM_ACCESS_CHECKED_WR
events.description: Checked data memory access, write

events.name: ASE_INST_SPEC
events.description: Advanced SIMD operations speculatively executed

events.name: SVE_INST_SPEC
events.description: SVE operation, including load/store

events.name: FP_HP_SPEC
events.description: Half-precision floating-point operation speculatively executed

events.name: FP_SP_SPEC
events.description: Single-precision floating-point operation speculatively executed

events.name: FP_DP_SPEC
events.description: Double-precision floating-point operation speculatively executed

events.name: SVE_PRED_SPEC
events.description: SVE predicated operations speculatively executed

events.name: SVE_PRED_EMPTY_SPEC
events.description: SVE predicated operations with no active predicates speculatively executed

events.name: SVE_PRED_FULL_SPEC
events.description: SVE predicated operations with all active predicates speculatively executed

events.name: SVE_PRED_PARTIAL_SPEC
events.description: SVE predicated operations with partially active predicates speculatively executed

events.name: SVE_PRED_NOT_FULL_SPEC
events.description: SVE predicated operations with no or partially active predicates speculatively executed

events.name: SVE_LDFF_SPEC
events.description: SVE First-fault load operations speculatively executed

events.name: SVE_LDFF_FAULT_SPEC
events.description: SVE First-fault load operations speculatively executed which set FFR bit to 0

events.name: FP_SCALE_OPS_SPEC
events.description: Scalable floating-point element operations speculatively executed

events.name: FP_FIXED_OPS_SPEC
events.description: Non-scalable floating-point element operations speculatively executed

events.name: ASE_SVE_INT8_SPEC
events.description: Advanced SIMD and SVE 8-bit integer operation speculatively executed

events.name: ASE_SVE_INT16_SPEC
events.description: Advanced SIMD and SVE 16-bit integer operation speculatively executed

events.name: ASE_SVE_INT32_SPEC
events.description: Advanced SIMD and SVE 32-bit integer operation speculatively executed

events.name: ASE_SVE_INT64_SPEC
events.description: Advanced SIMD and SVE 64-bit integer operation speculatively executed

events.name: BR_IMMED_TAKEN_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, immediate branch taken

events.name: BR_INDNR_TAKEN_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, indirect branch excluding procedure return retired

events.name: BR_IND_RETIRED
events.description: Instruction architecturally executed, indirect branch

events.name: DTLB_WALK_PERCYC
events.description: Total cycles, DTLB_WALK The counter counts by the number of data TLB walk events in progress on each processor cycle

events.name: ITLB_WALK_PERCYC
events.description: Total cycles, ITLB_WALK The counter counts by the number of instruction TLB walk events in progress on each processor cycle

events.name: DTLB_STEP
events.description: Data TLB translation table walk, step The counter counts each translation table walk access made by a refill of the data or unified TLB

events.name: ITLB_STEP
events.description: Instruction TLB translation table walk, step The counter counts each translation table walk access made by a refill of the instruction TLB

events.name: STALL_FRONTEND_FLUSH
events.description: No operation sent for execution due to the frontend flush recovery
